- Dimension : Size of the image
- Count: Number of image
# Output

llm:engine
info:
This node is a wrapper of Azure OpenAI Client.

# Input

Model's credential should be provide using environment mechanism. See llm:Model documentation.

- User : A string of the user's query
- Context: A String or an object to stringify with some context (It will generate chat messsage, after System message)
- History: An array of previous chat message
- Tools: An array of tool (JSON) used by OpenAI

# Output

The node will output a `msg.llm` object with all underlaying elements
 1. Errors (look into msg.llm.error)
 2. Tools to handle
 3. Response

# Tools

Tools JSON format must follow Azure OAI documentation.
```
const tool = {
    name: "LLM_Tool_Name",
    description: "Tool descirption",
    parameters: {
        type: "object",
        properties: {
            query: {
                type: "string",
                description: "Tool field description",
            },
        },
        required: ["query"],
    },
};
msg.llm.tools = msg.llm.tools || []
msg.llm.tools.push({ type: "function", function: tool })
```


You should set a Switch node that look into `llm.tool.function.name`
then your code MUST call a callback function `msg.llm.toolCallback(string_result)`;

func:
let result = msg.llm.result
let img    = result.data[0]

delete img.content_filter_results
delete img.prompt_filter_results

msg.llm.toolCallback(img);
msg.payload = 'Revised prompt: ' + img.revised_prompt

return msg;

llm:search
info:
This node return a sorted array of Cosine Similarities
- a String query or an embedding
- an array of documents

# Input

Model's credential should be provide using environment mechanism. See llm:Model documentation.
- Query : String or Embedding
- Database: Array of Documents
- Dimensions: Size of Embeddings

Array of documents must be follow this template. See also llm:extractor documentation
```
[
    {
        chunks : [
            data : {
                data: String
                embedding : [...]
            }
        ]
    }
]
```

name: Cosine Similarity
Variables
llm:extractor
info:
Split input data into chunck, create embedding, output a document and cache it on disk

# Input

Model's credential should be provide using environment mechanism. See llm:Model documentation.

- Source: a unique name used to cache the document
- Override: override the cache 
- Buffer: an input buffer (Pdf). URL & Text are alternate option to Buffer 
- Metadata: store metadata aside the document 
- Chunck Size: Size of the chunks
- Chunk Overlap : Overlap some part of the chunk 
- Dimensions: Embedding size

# Output

Document with the following template.
```
[
    {
        chunks : [
            data : {
                data: String
                embedding : [...]
            }
        ]
    }
]

name: Variables
Buffer Extractor
TextSplitter
Build Document
llm:model
info:
This node build and cache Azure OpenAI Client.

# Input

Model's credential should be provide using environment mechanism. 
So all the custom variable related to the project will be stored in one location.
You can use a pattern like `env-llm-gpt4-key` for you env variables.

- Model: the name of the Model
- Key: The Azure API Key
- Endpoint : The Azure API Endpoint

# Output

The model is return into `msg.llm.model`
The model is cached at Node level.

llm:embed
info:
This node is a wrapper of Azure OpenAI Client to generate Embedding.
Embedding are cache into a LRU.

# Input
Model's credential should be provide using environment mechanism. See llm:Model documentation.

- Dimension : Size of the embedding array
- Data: The data to convert
- Format: Stringify the embedding

# Output

The node will output a `msg.llm` object with all underlaying elements
 1. Errors (look into msg.llm.error)
 2. Tools to handle
 3. Response

meta.author: Jean-Philippe Encausse <jp@encausse.net>
meta.desc: Wrapper on Azure OpenAI Client for Embeddings
